title: Rebozo, 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: warp resist dyed before weaving (jaspe), warp-faced plain weave
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 210 x 73 cm (6 ft. 10 11/16 in. x 28 3/4 in.)
description: Warp jaspeado composed of alternating stripes: one a floral motif in blue and white, and the other a checkerboard in blue and red, blue and green, or blue and yellow, a pair of red left and right of center. At both sides, a chevron and an outer blue stripes. Warps at both ends knotted to form open work triangular points with tassels of various colors added.

tombstone.epitaph:
Rebozo, 20th century.Medium: cotton
Technique: warp resist dyed before weaving (jaspe), warp-faced plain weave. 1979-90-2.
